titles.title: To designate the Federal building located at the northeast corner of the intersection of 14th Street and Independence Avenue, Southwest, in Washington, District of Columbia, as the "Jamie L. Whitten Federal Building".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Mr. Traficant moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Considered under suspension of the rules.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Baucus without amendment. Without written report.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 572.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 6/14/1994--Introduced. Designates the Federal building located at the northeast corner of the intersection of 14th Street and Independence Avenue, Southwest, Washington, D.C., as the Jamie L. Whitten Federal Building.
